Context:
Program Name: Analytics for Business Decision Making
Code: B422
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Duration: 8 months (2 semesters)
Method of Study: Full-time (Online)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,379.00 \*
Location: Online
Experiential Learning: Simulated Learning Environment.
Program Overview: Harnessing the power of big data analytics, the program prepares students for careers in business analytics. The eight-month online postgraduate certificate provides knowledge and skills needed to support real-world business decision-making through data insights, data management, and data science.
Note: This program is also offered in a blended hybrid format with the code B412.

* Please check the official college website or contact the admission office for the most up-to-date tuition fee information.

Context:
The "Analytics for Business Decision-Making" online postgraduate certificate program is offered by the "School of Management" at George Brown College in Toronto, Canada. The program focuses on developing skills for data analysis specific to business decision-making needs. Students will learn how to convert data into intelligence and actionable insights.

The program covers a mix of technical skills such as programming, applied statistical comprehension, and database understanding, all within the context of organizational Big Data requirements. It is offered in a blended hybrid format for students who apply to B412.

Minimum computing requirements include a PC running Windows 8 or higher with 8MB RAM and an i5 processor, Microsoft WindowsÂ® 10 or Server 2016 + 64-bit versions of Windows, web camera and microphone, and PC Version Microsoft Office including Access. For students using Apple/Mac environments, they must have Bootcamp/Parallels, a copy of Windows 10, and Microsoft Office including Access.

The program includes a self-directed, faculty-guided research and analytics project called the BUS 4045 Data Project Capstone Project.

Application for the blended hybrid format should be submitted to B412.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Analytics for Business Decision-Making Program (Online) (Postgraduate) B422 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The 45 Data Project Capstone Project is a self-directed, faculty-guided research and analytics project that allows students to support business decisions and gain valuable work experience. The Analytics Hub brings together students, faculty, and industry to derive insights from data.

Graduates of this program are prepared for careers in various organizations including marketing research firms, polling firms, branding/design firms, insurance and finance firms, loyalty programs, health care, public sector, manufacturing and supply chain. Potential positions may include business analyst, data analyst, market risk analytics officer, web analytics manager, decision support specialist, web analyst, and data reporting analyst.

To graduate, students must complete 14 mandatory courses. The required courses for the first semester include BUS 4046 - Introduction to Business Analytics, BUS 4047 - Applied Business Communication, COMP 4007 - Computer Applications Involving Analytics, MGMT 4030 - Business Research, MGMT 4084 - Digital Media Analysis, STAT 4001 - Statistics I for Analytics, and BUS 4022 - Programming Fundamentals for Analytics. The required courses for the second semester include MARK 4018 - Data Mining & Modelling, COMP 4008 - Advanced Computer Applications involving Analytics, BUS 4023 - Business, Web and Social Media Metrics and Analysis, BUS 4024 - Business Decision-Making Through Advanced Analytics, BUS 4022 - Business, Programming Fundamentals for Analytics, MGMT 4083 - Business Metrics, and STAT 4003 - Statistics II for Analytics.

There is no explicit mention of the name of the program offered by the college in the given text.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Analytics for Business Decision-Making Program (Online) (Postgraduate) B422 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Offered: The graduate demonstrates skills in statistics and data analysis with a focus on analytics. Specific courses mentioned include STAT 4001 and STAT 4003. The program covers topics such as extracting, transforming and loading data, data warehousing, model development, business intelligence tools usage, communication of results, statistical techniques application to Big Data, digital information analysis, and ethics in data use for business decision-making.

Program Learning Outcomes: The graduate will be able to efficiently support problem-solving and decision-making through data manipulation; warehouse and mine data for business decision-making purposes; develop classification and predictive models using operational and marketing data; effectively communicate analytics results using various methods; apply statistical techniques to Big Data; analyze and interpret digital information for an organization; and apply business ethics and corporate social responsibility principles in the use of data.

Costs: The tuition and fees for domestic students for the first two semesters is $4,379.00*. Financial assistance is available through OSAP for eligible applicants.

Admission Requirements: Applicants need a college advanced diploma (three-year), bachelor's degree, or relevant work experience with a resume and references. English language proficiency tests are required for some international applicants. College credits may be transferable for exemptions. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.

*Note: Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and at later dates.
